questions.question: Which of the following is a supervised learning technique used for predicting classes/labels of unseen data based on historical data with pre-defined labels?
In the classification process, what is the primary purpose of the learning step (training phase)?
options: Estimating the accuracy of classification rules

questions.question: What is the key difference between multi-label and multi-class classification?
options: Multi-label allows one object to belong to multiple classes, while multi-class allows only one class per sample.
Multi-class allows one object to belong to multiple classes, while multi-label allows only one class per sample.
Multi-label is used for text categorization, while multi-class is used for image classification.
There is no difference between multi-label and multi-class classification.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a validation set in machine learning?
options: To test the model's generalized error

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an advantage of the K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) algorithm?
options: Effective if training data is large

questions.question: What is the 'naive' assumption in the Naive Bayes classifier?
options: Features are dependent on each other
The presence of a particular feature in a class is unrelated to the presence of any other feature

questions.question: What is Laplacian correction (or smoothing) used for in Naive Bayes?
options: To improve accuracy on large datasets

questions.question: What is the main idea behind Support Vector Machines (SVM)?
options: To minimize the distance between data points
To create a line or hyperplane that separates data into classes
To find the nearest neighbors of a data point
To calculate probabilities of class membership

questions.question: Which method involves partitioning the data into k mutually exclusive subsets, using one subset as the test set and the others as training sets iteratively?
In the context of imbalanced datasets, what does SMOTE do?
